column11: EVENT TEXT
column236: NEARBY SHIP DRONE CONTROL SYSTEM CAPACITY
column237: NEARBY SHIP DRONE CONTROL SYSTEM POWER
column238: NEARBY SHIP DRONE CONTROL SYSTEM DAMAGE
column289: HULL DAMAGE NEEDED FOR ESCAPE ATTEMPT

column11: The data you carry is vital to the remaining Federation fleet. You'll need supplies for the journey, so make sure to explore each sector before moving on to the next. But get to the exit before the pursuing Rebel fleet can catch up!  TIP: Upgrades -  Don't forget to upgrade your ship! Often shields are the highest priority, but don't underestimate the usefulness of subsystems.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
You beam the Federation crew aboard. One gladly joins your crew, the rest wait to be dropped off at the next station.
Now that their ship has been emptied of hostiles, you search it. Eventually you find a prisoner who offers to join your crew.
There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You strip it of useful materials.
A ship engineer has set up a small shop here.
column12: System: drones, battery, hacking, Weapon: LASER CHARGEGUN 2, LASER BURST 2 A, ION CHARGEGUN,

column11: Upon closer inspection it appears to have a large portion of its hull destroyed. You take what few supplies you can find.
With the pirate ship disabled, your engines come online again. You salvage what you can from their ship.
With the crew dead, you search the ship. You find military-grade weaponry and take what looks most useful.

It appears the slaves did not survive the fighting. You find their burnt bodies in the hold, but before you strip the ship you hear faint noises in the walls. You break off a latch and a slave falls out of a hidden compartment, coughing. Once recomposed the slave offers to join your crew.
You have arrived in Engi space. The fall of the Federation has brought tough times for these robotic lifeforms, but they're usually willing to help.

To your surprise your Engi crewmember reforms. It looks as if the virus reconstituted, repurposed, and reprogrammed the Engi host and wants to travel with you... and it seems to have learned a great deal from its time on your ship.
Thank you for your business.
The Engi can do remarkable things with just a pile of scrap. The Engi hive at this beacon are selling equipment for just that.
column12: Crew: Zoltan, Human, Engi, Augment: LIFE SCANNER, HACKING STUN, EXPLOSIVE REPLICATOR, System: drones, cloaking, mind,

column11: You arrive in a system and immediately discover a pirate ship nearby. Strangely, scans indicate there are no lifeforms aboard. You salvage anything useful, but find no clue as to the whereabouts of the former crew.
There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You strip it of useful materials.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have much by way of supplies but they do offer a drone schematic for your use.
There are a number of merchant ships passing through the area despite the threat of Mantis invasion. No doubt interested in buying the efficient technology of the Engi.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis. He won't go easily, and causes serious damage before he can be captured.

They reluctantly agree. Once aboard, you watch as their ship crashes against a massive rock. They thank you, but say I don't know what we'll do without our ship. As the Captain, I feel obligated to help you with your mission.
You make the exchange and their team comes on board to try to improve your reactor.
You arrive in Zoltan space. From what you have heard they anticipated the coming war and made preparations to hold their borders.
While you scrap their ship, you wonder what it was that could have provoked them to act so irrationally.
A Mantis crew here has hunkered down in the abdomen of a long-dead space-whale - the only way, presumably, for them to operate their black-market trade without detection. Worth a look?
column12: System: drones, medbay, hacking, Drone: DEFENSE 2, ANTI DRONE, REPAIR, Crew: Human, Engi, Rock, Augment: FTL BOOSTER, BATTERY BOOSTER, EXPLOSIVE REPLICATOR,

column11: The Zoltan are fascinated by other species, and have set up something of an alien knick-knack shop here. Why not take a look?
column12: System: drones, medbay, cloaking, Weapon: LASER BURST 2 A, LASER BURST 5, MISSILES BREACH, Drone: DEFENSE 1, COMBAT 1, COMBAT BEAM,

column11: Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.

column12: System: drones, medbay, cloaking, Weapon: LASER BURST 2 A, LASER BURST 5, MISSILES BREACH, Drone: DEFENSE 1, COMBAT 1, COMBAT BEAM,

column11: The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
You receive a wide-band message, Free schematic samples! Be sure to visit our new military-grade drone store opening in sector XR1-45!
There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You strip it of useful materials.
Thanks to the high nebula density of this sector very little of it has been charted, and rumours of what lurks in the depths abound.
An Engi cargo vessel hails: Propose mutually beneficial exchange of properties. That smells like a bargain.
column12: System: drones, mind, hacking, Drone: COMBAT BEAM 2, COMBAT 1, REPAIR,

column11: There is only one other ship at this beacon, and it is showing heavy damage. You receive a message on your console: Greetings traveler. We were crippled by a band of pirates and are now forced to sell our remaining valuable equipment to acquire the necessary supplies to get home.
column12: System: medbay, cloaking, mind, Crew: Zoltan, Engi, Human,

column11: Searching the remains you find that the cargo was military-grade Drone Schematics! You bring them aboard to install on your ship.
You see a small station nearby and feel the shudder of shots ringing through the ship. You can't be sure without sensors, but it seems there may be intruders on the ship!
You cycle through wide-band comm channels as soon as you arrive. Nothing but static.
With the sensors down, you spend a good deal of time staring out the window. It is, you must admit, rather beautiful here.
You find a weapon system on their ship. With no crew to stop you, you can install it on your own.
You nervously glance out the windows but the only thing to greet you is more clouds and silence.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
The station was either abandoned or stripped clean. It seems to have lain unused for quite some time. You find nothing useful.
This Long-Range Beacon is almost hidden within a nebula. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.
Welcome to a new sector! Get to the exit beacon and jump to the next sector before the pursuing Rebels catch you!
